</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. markets: </strong></span><span>In the first trading day of the second quarter, stocks came out of the locker room like the Patriots in Super Bowl LI. Markets may have been reacting to President Trump’s admission Tuesday night that the country has a “</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/31/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">very, very painful</a></span><span>” two weeks ahead.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. economy: </strong></span><span>A few more grim data points—</span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy-jobs/u-s-manufacturing-contracts-private-payrolls-post-first-drop-since-2017-idUSKBN21J5IR?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">manufacturing and private payrolls</a></span><span>—confirmed to some economists that we’re looking at a deep, deep recession if not a depression. We'll find out weekly jobless claims this morning. </span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SMALL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/01/sba-lenders-gird-small-business-applications?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How to Move $349 Billion in 10 Days
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="ATM stuffed with dollars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/439/atm.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="ATM stuffed with dollars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/439/atm.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Strict social distancing measures intended to stymie the spread of the coronavirus have nearly drowned many of the U.S.’ small businesses. Their <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-lending/u-s-small-businesses-wait-impatiently-for-government-aid-that-could-be-slow-to-come-idUSKBN21J59D?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">life raft</a>—$349 billion worth of loans from last week’s stimulus bill—will be available starting tomorrow, say Trump administration officials.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The flow chart: </strong>Funds from the Treasury Department → the Small Business Administration (SBA) → lenders → bruised small businesses</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The problem: </strong>The need is enormous, and two links in that chain, the SBA and lenders, may not be ready to meet it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Small Business Administration wasn’t exactly Agency of the Month to begin with—its inspector general’s office found it didn’t get loans out the door fast enough after Hurricane Harvey destroyed much of the Houston area in 2017. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To accommodate this loan program, it will reportedly have three months to process more than 10 times the dollar amount it issued all of last year. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As for lenders...</strong>industry analysts say the tsunami of applications could overwhelm their systems. And some bankers are saying they're missing the detailed guidance necessary to get approved. <br><br><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>“Paycheck protection” is the name of the stimulus game. If small firms don’t receive help, they’ll have no choice but to cut staff, if they haven’t already. Those workers would then stop spending, knocking over an endless line of economic dominos. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A (potential) white knight </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jack Dorsey’s night job: fintech. Digital platforms like Numerated say they’re customizing their services for businesses applying for the loans. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Many fintechs weren’t SBA-approved lenders until recently. Last week, leaders like Square CEO Dorsey </span><span><a href="https://mobile.twitter.com/MehrsaBaradaran/status/1243297854866653184?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pressured the government</a></span><span> to let them ~lend~ a hand. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over the weekend, Treasury Sec. Steve Mnuchin said their hoodie-clad services were welcome. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One (potential) silver lining: </strong>The mountain of applications may give banks <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c584885c-6d64-4531-99e6-334c6ec0c57c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a boost in fees</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/01/streaming-numbers-way-march?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’re Definitely Still Watching
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="streaming stats nielsen" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDAvc3RyZWFtaW5nX3N0YXRzX25pZWxzZW4ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In our March 12 newsletter, we wrote, “We all know ‘working from home’ roughly translates to ‘rewatching <em>The Sopranos</em>.’” Well call us Joe Exotic because our theory was right all along.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Being stuck at home sends us straight into binge mode.</strong> Americans streamed 85% more minutes of video in March 2020 than in March 2019, according to new Nielsen data.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The average person has spent 36% more minutes streaming TV and movies in the last four weeks.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Binge watching (or watching 3+ episodes in one sitting, per the Hulu English Dictionary) has climbed more than 25% over the last two weeks.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Netflix claimed the <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/streaming-gets-big-bump-coronavirus-quarantines-nielsen-says-1287682?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest share</a> of streaming minutes in the last week of March with 29% to YouTube’s 20%, Hulu’s 10%, and Amazon’s 9%. But if our newfound appreciation for binging continues post-pandemic as <a href="https://www.axios.com/streaming-spikes-during-coronavirus-c37a9cb2-8e14-4481-95f7-62ac1fa0222d.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some media experts anticipate</a>, this is a plus for all streamers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One more TV headline for the road:</strong> Hulu founder Jason Kilar was named <a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2020-04-01/former-hulu-boss-jason-kilar-named-warnermedia-ceo-ahead-of-hbo-max-launch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CEO of WarnerMedia</a>. He’s tasked with launching parent AT&T’s HBO Max streaming service—the most expensive in the streaming wars at $14.99/month—in May.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/01/palantir-signs-governments-covid19-reponse?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Data’s Time to Shine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There are two theaters of war against the coronavirus:</strong> 1) the low-tech, which is us doing jigsaw puzzles and not touching our faces, and 2) the high-tech, which is governments and powerful companies using the latest database tools to trace the virus’s spread and plot the response. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of those powerful companies is Palantir, the Peter Thiel-founded, Silicon Valley big data giant that's been valued at $20 billion. It’s currently pitching its data mining services to governments across Europe, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-01/palantir-in-talks-with-germany-france-for-virus-fighting-tool?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports Bloomberg</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That would signal an expansion of its already extensive involvement in coronavirus tracking:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Palantir has been </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/to-track-virus-governments-weigh-surveillance-tools-that-push-privacy-limits-11584479841?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">modeling the outbreak</a></span><span> for the CDC as part of a long-term contract with the agency.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s also been enlisted by the U.K.’s </span><span><a href="https://healthtech.blog.gov.uk/2020/03/28/the-power-of-data-in-a-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">National Health Service</a></span><span> to coalesce “disparate data” into a “single source of truth that will support decision-making.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Palantir, whose clients have included the CIA and FBI, will invite questions of surveillance and privacy. But as <a href="https://www.economist.com/britain/2020/03/26/palantir-a-data-firm-loved-by-spooks-teams-up-with-britains-health-service?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Economist writes</a>, “if the work is done in the open, it could be a boon.” </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/01/coast-guard-tells-cruise-ships-stay-away-us-ports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Room in the Port of Miami
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="carnival cruise ship" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzcvY2Fybml2YWxfY3J1aXNlX3NoaXAuSlBHIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Nbx909" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nbx909</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Carnival_Destiny_Miami_12-22-11.JPG" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Carnival Destiny Miami 12-22-11</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 3.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, the U.S. Coast Guard told cruise ships with passengers possibly COVID-19 positive to <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/01/825205607/coast-guard-tells-cruise-ships-with-covid-19-cases-to-stay-away-from-u-s-ports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stay offshore</a> “indefinitely.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>Foreign-flagged ships carrying 50+ passengers were directed to <a href="https://fortune.com/2020/04/01/cruise-ships-out-of-florida-coronavirus-stuck-at-sea/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">treat sick people</a> at sea or seek help from the countries where they’re registered, since the U.S. healthcare system is already buckling.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The issue?</strong> They can’t go home. Lots of Carnival, Royal Caribbean, and Norwegian ships are registered in countries like the Bahamas to avoid U.S. tax, employment, and environmental laws—but those countries are <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/transportation/ports-waterways/490584-coast-guard-directs-cruise-ships-with-infected?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">even more strapped</a> than the U.S. for hospital beds.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FYI, Carnival said Tuesday it has over 6,000 passengers still at sea, where they’ve been since at least March 13 (the date new sailings were halted).</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Already facing an indefinite slump in demand, cruise companies wanted to hear this news like you want a root canal. Carnival just upped the size of a rescue bond package backed by its ships to $4 billion...and warned it still might only <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c3890c4e-d8a7-41ae-abea-b8bb714d803b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have enough cash</a> to survive eight more months.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/01/morning-brews-daily-quarantine-planner-april-2?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Daily Quarantine Planner: April 2
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many of you were wondering who was writing the Brew from Tallahassee. It's the panhandle's finest, Kinsey Grant. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/athletic-shoe_1f45f.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Morning workout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/projects/well/workouts/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">seven-minute workout</a> that requires nothing but a chair and the will to keep going when the side plank kicks in.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/headphone_1f3a7.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">  Work playlists</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/7EpJpnU6KrSc430F8B5tM7?si=ziTbxqphRziJZvdHoVZ64g&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Poolside in Your Mind</a> is perfect for those aching for summertime. Alternatively, <a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/37i9dQZF1DXbPHTEEyQ6Hv?si=9eF85npcTEqgdWZx6Izlqg&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Christmas Peaceful Piano</a> is what I, a person always aching for the holidays, listen to during work.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/green-salad_1f957.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Lunch break, but make it productive</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Do good: </strong>We’ve been writing a lot about people losing their jobs. Here’s a <a href="https://www.themuse.com/advice/companies-hiring-during-coronavirus-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">list of companies hiring</a> right now.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Level up:</strong> Behold <a href="https://twitter.com/MerriamWebster/status/1240727915500888067?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this Twitter thread</a> from Merriam-Webster of “beautiful, obscure, and often quite useless words.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Or don’t:</strong> Ina Garten <a href="https://www.instagram.com/tv/B-cJUwUpxbM/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">makes a convincing case</a> for “it’s always 5 o’clock in quarantine.” Also, she makes cosmos.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/video-camera_1f4f9.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Things to send your group chat</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vulture compiled the <a href="https://www.vulture.com/2020/03/the-funniest-coronavirus-jokes.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best memes and tweets</a> about the current state of affairs. There’s nothing funny about a pandemic-recession combo, but the world still needs comedy. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Dinner plans</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Check out <a href="https://www.instagram.com/halfbakedharvest/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Half Baked Harvest</a> on Instagram for a mix of both health and hedonism. I’m eyeing the cheesy herb-stuffed naan, anyone with me?</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Evening activities</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No screen:</strong> Birdwatching has become one of my favorite socially distanced pastimes. Check out local feeding times (which often conveniently coincide with cocktail hour), read up on <a href="https://www.humanesociety.org/resources/feeding-your-backyard-birds?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the dos and don’ts</a>, grab binoculars, and start calling yourself an amateur ornithologist.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Screen: </strong>Settle in for these nine <a href="https://www.theringer.com/movies/2020/3/23/21190688/nine-long-movies-to-watch-on-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extremely good, extremely long streamable movies</a> The Ringer rounded up. If that’s not enough, The Atlantic has the <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/culture/archive/2020/03/covid19-coronavirus-social-distancing-netflix-hulu/608398/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">perfect film</a> for every stay-at-home mood.</p>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_042020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>

Markets may have been reacting to President Trump’s admission Tuesday night that the country has a “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/31/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003every, very painful\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” two weeks ahead.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. economy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA few more grim data points—\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy-jobs/u-s-manufacturing-contracts-private-payrolls-post-first-drop-since-2017-idUSKBN21J5IR?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emanufacturing and private payrolls\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e—confirmed to some economists that we’re looking at a deep, deep recession if not a depression. We'll find out weekly jobless claims this morning. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSMALL BIZ \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/01/sba-lenders-gird-small-business-applications?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHow to Move $349 Billion in 10 Days\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"ATM stuffed with dollars\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=447 src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/439/atm.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"ATM stuffed with dollars\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/439/atm.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStrict social distancing measures intended to stymie the spread of the coronavirus have nearly drowned many of the U.S.’ small businesses. Their \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-lending/u-s-small-businesses-wait-impatiently-for-government-aid-that-could-be-slow-to-come-idUSKBN21J59D?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elife raft\u003c/a\u003e—$349 billion worth of loans from last week’s stimulus bill—will be available starting tomorrow, say Trump administration officials.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe flow chart: \u003c/strong\u003eFunds from the Treasury Department → the Small Business Administration (SBA) → lenders → bruised small businesses\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe problem: \u003c/strong\u003eThe need is enormous, and two links in that chain, the SBA and lenders, may not be ready to meet it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Small Business Administration wasn’t exactly Agency of the Month to begin with—its inspector general’s office found it didn’t get loans out the door fast enough after Hurricane Harvey destroyed much of the Houston area in 2017. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo accommodate this loan program, it will reportedly have three months to process more than 10 times the dollar amount it issued all of last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAs for lenders...\u003c/strong\u003eindustry analysts say the tsunami of applications could overwhelm their systems. And some bankers are saying they're missing the detailed guidance necessary to get approved. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003e“Paycheck protection” is the name of the stimulus game. If small firms don’t receive help, they’ll have no choice but to cut staff, if they haven’t already. Those workers would then stop spending, knocking over an endless line of economic dominos. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA (potential) white knight \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJack Dorsey’s night job: fintech. Digital platforms like Numerated say they’re customizing their services for businesses applying for the loans. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMany fintechs weren’t SBA-approved lenders until recently. Last week, leaders like Square CEO Dorsey \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://mobile.twitter.com/MehrsaBaradaran/status/1243297854866653184?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epressured the government\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to let them ~lend~ a hand. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver the weekend, Treasury Sec. Steve Mnuchin said their hoodie-clad services were welcome. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne (potential) silver lining: \u003c/strong\u003eThe mountain of applications may give banks \u003ca collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn our March 12 newsletter, we wrote, “We all know ‘working from home’ roughly translates to ‘rewatching \u003cem\u003eThe Sopranos\u003c/em\u003e.’” Well call us Joe Exotic because our theory was right all along.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBeing stuck at home sends us straight into binge mode.\u003c/strong\u003e Americans streamed 85% more minutes of video in March 2020 than in March 2019, according to new Nielsen data.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe average person has spent 36% more minutes streaming TV and movies in the last four weeks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBinge watching (or watching 3+ episodes in one sitting, per the Hulu English Dictionary) has climbed more than 25% over the last two weeks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eNetflix claimed the \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/streaming-gets-big-bump-coronavirus-quarantines-nielsen-says-1287682?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest share\u003c/a\u003e of streaming minutes in the last week of March with 29% to YouTube’s 20%, Hulu’s 10%, and Amazon’s 9%. But if our newfound appreciation for binging continues post-pandemic as \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/streaming-spikes-during-coronavirus-c37a9cb2-8e14-4481-95f7-62ac1fa0222d.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esome media experts anticipate\u003c/a\u003e, this is a plus for all streamers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne more TV headline for the road:\u003c/strong\u003e Hulu founder Jason Kilar was named \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2020-04-01/former-hulu-boss-jason-kilar-named-warnermedia-ceo-ahead-of-hbo-max-launch?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCEO of WarnerMedia\u003c/a\u003e. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere are two theaters of war against the coronavirus:\u003c/strong\u003e 1) the low-tech, which is us doing jigsaw puzzles and not touching our faces, and 2) the high-tech, which is governments and powerful companies using the latest database tools to trace the virus’s spread and plot the response. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of those powerful companies is Palantir, the Peter Thiel-founded, Silicon Valley big data giant that's been valued at $20 billion. It’s currently pitching its data mining services to governments across Europe, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-01/palantir-in-talks-with-germany-france-for-virus-fighting-tool?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat would signal an expansion of its already extensive involvement in coronavirus tracking:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePalantir has been \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/to-track-virus-governments-weigh-surveillance-tools-that-push-privacy-limits-11584479841?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emodeling the outbreak\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the CDC as part of a long-term contract with the agency.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt’s also been enlisted by the U.K.’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://healthtech.blog.gov.uk/2020/03/28/the-power-of-data-in-a-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNational Health Service\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to coalesce “disparate data” into a “single source of truth that will support decision-making.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003ePalantir, whose clients have included the CIA and FBI, will invite questions of surveillance and privacy. But as \u003ca href=\"https://www.economist.com/britain/2020/03/26/palantir-a-data-firm-loved-by-spooks-teams-up-with-britains-health-service?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Economist writes\u003c/a\u003e, “if the work is done in the open, it could be a href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/01/825205607/coast-guard-tells-cruise-ships-with-covid-19-cases-to-stay-away-from-u-s-ports?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eForeign-flagged ships carrying 50+ passengers were directed to \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2020/04/01/cruise-ships-out-of-florida-coronavirus-stuck-at-sea/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etreat sick people\u003c/a\u003e at sea or seek help from the countries where they’re registered, since the U.S. healthcare system is already buckling.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe issue?\u003c/strong\u003e They can’t go home. Lots of Carnival, Royal Caribbean, and Norwegian ships are registered in countries like the Bahamas to avoid U.S. tax, employment, and environmental laws—but those countries are \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/transportation/ports-waterways/490584-coast-guard-directs-cruise-ships-with-infected?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeven more strapped\u003c/a\u003e than the U.S. for hospital beds.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFYI, Carnival said Tuesday it has over 6,000 passengers still at sea, where they’ve been since at least March 13 (the date new sailings were halted).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAlready facing an indefinite slump in demand, cruise companies wanted to hear this news like you want a root canal. Carnival just upped the size of a rescue bond package backed by its ships to $4 billion...and warned it still might only \u003ca
